localizedDescriptions.en: Document to communicate information to others, commonly in response to a request from another party.

annotations.Notes.Authors Note: This description may be useful to display in the UI: Document to communicate relevant patient information and summary recommendations from ReSPECT (Recommended Summary Plan for Emergency Care and Treatment) process.

localizedDescriptions.en: The status of the entire report. Note: This is not the status of any of the report components.
Additional composition metadata aligned with IHE-XDS which is not already available from the Reference Model COMPOSITION class.
The code specifying the precise type of document from the user perspective. Normally selected from a valueset provided by the local IHE-XDS Affinity Domain or national standard.

annotations.comment:
for example:  Pulmonary History and Physical, Discharge Summary, Ultrasound Report.
These codes are specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.

inputs.defaultValue: Living will and advance directive record (record artifact)

localizedDescriptions.en: Top level heading for capturing details of ReSPECT process.
Heading containing summary of relevant information for the ReSPECT process.
Narrative summary or overview about a patient, specifically from the perspective of a healthcare provider, and with or without associated interpretations.
The summary, assessment, conclusions or evaluation of the clinical findings.

children.name: Details of other relevant care planning documents and where to find them
children.localizedName: Details of other relevant care planning documents and where to find them

localizedNames.en: Details of other relevant care planning documents and where to find them

localizedDescriptions.en: A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.

children.aqlPath: /content[openEHR-EHR-SECTION.respect_headings.v0]/items[at0001]/items[openEHR-EHR-SECTION.adhoc.v1,'Details of other relevant care planning documents and where to find them']

children.name: Advance planning document

localizedDescriptions.en: A framework to communicate the preferences of an individual for future medical treatment and care.

children.aqlPath: /content[openEHR-EHR-SECTION.respect_headings.v0]/items[at0001]/items[openEHR-EHR-SECTION.adhoc.v1,'Details of other relevant care planning documents and where to find them']/items[openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.advance_care_directive.v1,'Advance planning document']

children.name: Description

localizedDescriptions.en: Narrative description of the overall advance care directive.

annotations.comment: May be used to record a narrative overview of the complete advance care directive, which may or may not be supported by structured data. Details of specific structured findings can be included using CLUSTER archetypes in the 'Directive details' slot. This data element may be used to capture legacy data that is not available in a structured format.

children.aqlPath: /content[openEHR-EHR-SECTION.respect_headings.v0]/items[at0001]/items[openEHR-EHR-SECTION.adhoc.v1,'Details of other relevant care planning documents and where to find them']/items[openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.advance_care_directive.v1,'Advance planning document']/data[at0001]/items[at0006]/value

children.name: Language
children.aqlPath: /content[openEHR-EHR-SECTION.respect_headings.v0]/items[at0001]/items[openEHR-EHR-SECTION.adhoc.v1,'Details of other relevant care planning documents and where to find them']/items[openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.advance_care_directive.v1,'Advance planning document']/language

children.name: Encoding
children.aqlPath: /content[openEHR-EHR-SECTION.respect_headings.v0]/items[at0001]/items[openEHR-EHR-SECTION.adhoc.v1,'Details of other relevant care planning documents and where to find them']/items[openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.advance_care_directive.v1,'Advance planning document']/encoding

children.name: Subject
children.aqlPath: /content[openEHR-EHR-SECTION.respect_headings.v0]/items[at0001]/items[openEHR-EHR-SECTION.adhoc.v1,'Details of other relevant care planning documents and where to find them']/items[openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.advance_care_directive.v1,'Advance planning document']/subject

localizedDescriptions.en: This section indicates that the enclosed information is stored in a different composition/template but is intended to be referenced here.
A framework to communicate information about legal directives or orders that apply to the individual, for example, a power of attorney or guardianship order.
The type of legal directive or order that applies to the individual.

annotations.comment: Coding of the type of legal directive or order with a terminology is preferred, where possible. It is expected that this is largely localised to reflect local policy and legislation. For example, 'Welfare Power of Attorney', 'Welfare Guardianship Order' or 'Emergency Detention Order'.

localizedDescriptions.en: The status of the legal directive or order.

annotations.comment: Coding of the legal directive or order status with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: A legal directive or order is present.
A legal directive or order is absent.
Details of personal preferences to guide this ReSPECT plan (where the person has capacity).
About me

children.name: What I most value
children.aqlPath: /content[openEHR-EHR-SECTION.respect_headings.v0]/items[at0006]/items[openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.about_me.v0,'What matters to me']/data[at0001]/items[at0002,'What I most value']/value

children.name: What I most fear / wish to avoid
children.localizedName: What I most fear / wish to avoid

localizedNames.en: What I most fear / wish to avoid

children.aqlPath: /content[openEHR-EHR-SECTION.respect_headings.v0]/items[at0006]/items[openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.about_me.v0,'What matters to me']/data[at0001]/items[at0002,'What I most fear / wish to avoid']/value

localizedDescriptions.en: Eol Status
Not in last year of life.
In last year of life.
Last weeks of life
Last days of days
Summary of clinical recommendations for emergency care and treatment.
A suggestion, advice or proposal for clinical management.

annotations.Notes.Authors Note: This description may be useful to display in the UI: Summary of agreed and realistic clinical recommendations for emergency care and treatment.

localizedDescriptions.en: Narrative description of the recommendation.

annotations.Notes.Authors Note: This description may be useful to display in the UI: Focus on life-sustaining treatment or symptom control according to clinical guidance on specific interventions specified below.
annotations.comment: May be coded, using a terminology, if required.

list.value: Balance extending life with comfort and valued outcomes
list.label: Balance extending life with comfort and valued outcomes

localizedDescriptions.en: Justifications for the recommendation.

annotations.Notes.Authors Note: This description may be useful to display in the UI: Clinician's guidance on specific interventions that may or may not be wanted or be clinically appropriate, including being taken or admitted to hospital +/- receiving life support.

localizedDescriptions.en: The advance recommendation as to whether cardio-pulmonary resuscitation should be undertaken or not. This is generally referred to in UK clinical guidance as the CPR (Cardio-pulmonary resuscitation) decision.
The advance recommendation as to whether cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) should be attempted. In some cases a clear answer may not be available to the recording clinician.

list.label: CPR attempts recommended adult or child

localizedLabels.en: CPR attempts recommended adult or child

localizedDescriptions.en: Cardio-pulmonary resuscitation is recommended for adult or child.

list.label: CPR attempts not recommended adult or child.

localizedLabels.en: CPR attempts not recommended adult or child.

localizedDescriptions.en: Cardiopulmonary resuscitation is not recommended for adult or child.
There is no clear information on the outcome of the CPR decision.
Modified CPR is recommended for child only.
The date at which the CPR decision was originally taken or last reviewed.
Details of capacity and representation at the time of completion of the ReSPECT form.
The ability of an individual to use and understand information to make a decision or plan.
Description of the specific decision or plan to which the mental capacity status and assessment details relate.

children.name: Does the person have capacity to participate in making recommendations on this plan?
children.localizedName: Does the person have capacity to participate in making recommendations on this plan?

localizedNames.en: Does the person have capacity to participate in making recommendations on this plan?

localizedDescriptions.en: The individual's mental capacity status.

children.aqlPath: /content[openEHR-EHR-SECTION.respect_headings.v0]/items[at0008]/items[openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.mental_capacity.v0]/data[at0001]/items[at0002,'Does the person have capacity to participate in making recommendations on this plan?']/value

localizedDescriptions.en: The individual has sufficient mental capacity to make the decision or plan.
The individual does not have sufficient mental capacity to make the decision or plan.

children.name: If no, in what way does this person lack capacity?
children.localizedName: If no, in what way does this person lack capacity?

localizedNames.en: If no, in what way does this person lack capacity?

localizedDescriptions.en: Narrative description of the individual's mental capacity or incapacity.

children.aqlPath: /content[openEHR-EHR-SECTION.respect_headings.v0]/items[at0008]/items[openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.mental_capacity.v0]/data[at0001]/items[at0006,'If no, in what way does this person lack capacity?']/value

localizedDescriptions.en: Details of those involved and discussions in making the ReSPECT plan.
Details of involvement in making plan.
The clinician(s) signing this plan is/are confirming that these recommendations have at least one of A, B or C or valid reason for not selecting A,B or C fully documented in clinical record.
Details of involvement in making this plan.
This person has the mental capacity to participate in making these recommendations. They have been fully involved in making this plan.

list.label: B Person does not have mental capacity

localizedLabels.en: B Person does not have mental capacity

localizedDescriptions.en: This person does not have the mental capacity to participate in making these recommendations. This plan has been made in accordance with capacity law, including, where applicable, in consultation with their legal proxy, or where no proxy, with relevant family members/friends.

list.label: C1 Person less than 18 or 16 with sufficient maturity

localizedLabels.en: C1 Person less than 18 or 16 with sufficient maturity

localizedDescriptions.en: This person is less than 18 (UK except Scotland) / 16 (Scotland) and they have sufficient maturity and understanding to participate in making this plan.

list.label: C2 Person less than 18 or 16 without sufficient maturity

localizedLabels.en: C2 Person less than 18 or 16 without sufficient maturity

localizedDescriptions.en: This person is less than 18 (UK except Scotland) / 16 (Scotland) and they do not have sufficient maturity and understanding to participate in this plan. Their views, where known, have been taken into account.

list.label: C3 Person less than 18 or 16 parental decision

localizedLabels.en: C3 Person less than 18 or 16 parental decision

localizedDescriptions.en: This person is less than 18 (UK except Scotland) /16 (Scotland) and those holding parental responsibility have been fully involved in discussing and making this plan.
Description of reason for not selecting Options A, B or C or where C1 or C2 is selected without selecting C3.

annotations.comment:
Additional implementation guidance: in an electronic format, if someone selects D we could have a line coming up explaining that the only legal reasons for selecting D are:
1. if the physician thinks it would cause the patient physiological or psychological harm
2. if the patient lacks capacity, and it is not practicable or appropriate to contact those close to them.
If C1 or C2 has been selected without selecting C3, please document why involvement of those holding parental responsibility has not been possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: Details of clinicians involved in making ReSPECT plan.

annotations.comment: Implementation guidance - Add prompt to UI: The clinical signature is to indicate that the decision-making process has fully complied with relevant capacity and Human Rights legislation.

localizedDescriptions.en: A general clinical activity carried out for the patient to receive a specified service, advice or care from an expert healthcare provider.
Identification of the clinical service to be/being carried out.

annotations.comment: Coding of the specific service name with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: Details of emergency contacts for ReSPECT plan.
Care team details aligned with FHIR resource. This is an ADMIN ENTRY wrapper archetype to contain the Care team CLUSTER archetype where it has no natural ENTRY level parent.
Care team details aligned with FHIR resource.
A label for human use intended to distinguish like teams.
Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care team.
Indicates specific responsibility of an individual within the care team, such as "Primary care physician", "Trained social worker counselor", "Caregiver", etc.
Contacts for patients and organisations (excluding practitioners).
Name details aligned with FHIR resource.
Identification of the purpose for the name.
The usual name.
A text representation of the full name.
FHIR telecom details.
Telecommunications form for contact point - what communications system is required to make use of the contact.
The communication form is phone.
The actual contact point details, in a form that is meaningful to the designated communication system (i.e. phone number or email address).
Comments made about the participant.
Details of review dates and clinician for the confirmation of validity (e.g. for change of condition).
A general clinical activity carried out for the patient to receive a specified service, advice or care from an expert healthcare provider.
Identification of the clinical service to be/being carried out.

annotations.comment: Coding of the specific service name with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
